Package net.ssehub.comani.analysis.variabilitychange.core

Class ResultCollector

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.ssehub.comani.analysis.variabilitychange.core.ResultCollector
  • public class ResultCollector
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to write the results of the analysis to files.

    There are two files that will be created:
    • ComAn_Results.tsv: the general data extracted from each commit
    • ComAn_Summary.tsv: the summary of the numbers, e.g. the sum and average of changed files, etc.
    Author:
    Christian Kroeher

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ResultCollector getInstance()
        Return the single instance of the ResultCollector.
        Returns:
        the single instance of the ResultCollector

      • addResults

        public void addResults​(DiffAnalyzer diffAnalyzer,
                       java.io.File resultFile)
        Add the numbers provided by the given DiffAnalyzer to the end of the given result file as a new line and add these numbers to the respective sums over all commits.
        Parameters:
        diffAnalyzer - the DiffAnalyzer which provides the numbers to be added
        resultFile - a File to which the provided numbers will be added in terms of a appended new line

      • addUnanalyzed

        public void addUnanalyzed​(java.lang.String commitFileName,
                          java.io.File unanalyzedFile)
        Add a commit file to the list of unanalyzed commits in the given error file.
        Parameters:
        commitFileName - the name of the commit file that was not analyzed due to errors
        unanalyzedFile - the file containing all unanalyzed commits by file name

      • writeSummary

        public void writeSummary​(java.io.File summaryFile,
                         int commitFilesNum)
        Write the (final) summary of the analysis, e.g. the sum of changed files over all commits, the average numbers of changed lines per commit, etc.

        Note: This method will also reset the resultHeaderWritten flag to false such that if this singleton is called again for a different analysis, the column headers of the result file will be written.
        Parameters:
        summaryFile - the File to which the summary should be written; this file must exist and must be accessible
        commitFilesNum - the number of commit files involved in the analysis (this number may vary from the number of actually analyzed commits due to missing diff information)
